slots.description: A Dialog element to display.

members.name: responsive
members.description: When set to true, fills screens smaller than 350px high and 400px wide with the full dialog.

members.name: getUpdateComplete
members.description:
Bind the open/close transition into the update complete lifecycle so
that the overlay system can wait for it to be "visibly ready" before
attempting to throw focus into the content contained herein. Not
waiting for this can cause small amounts of page scroll to happen
while opening the Tray when focusable content is included: e.g. Menu
elements whose selected Menu Item is not the first Menu Item.

events.name: close
events.description: Announces that the dialog has been closed.

attributes.name: responsive
attributes.description: When set to true, fills screens smaller than 350px high and 400px wide with the full dialog.

slots.description: menu items to be listed in the menu

members.name: childRole
members.description:
Hide this getter from web-component-analyzer until
https://github.com/runem/web-component-analyzer/issues/131
has been addressed.

members.name: onFocusableItemAddedOrUpdated
members.description:
When a descendant `<sp-menu-item>` element is added or updated it will dispatch
this event to announce its presence in the DOM. During the capture phase the first
Menu based element that the event encounters will manage the focus state of the
dispatching `<sp-menu-item>` element.

members.name: onSelectableItemAddedOrUpdated
members.description:
When a descendant `<sp-menu-item>` element is added or updated it will dispatch
this event to announce its presence in the DOM. During the bubble phase the first
Menu based element that the event encounters that does not inherit selection will
manage the selection state of the dispatching `<sp-menu-item>` element.

events.name: change
events.description: Announces that the `value` of the element has changed

attributes.description: whether the element has a specific selection algorithm that it applies to its item descendants. `single` allows only one descendent to be selected at a time. `multiple` allows many descendants to be selected. `inherit` will be applied dynamically when an ancestor of this element is actively managing the selection of its descendents. When the `selects` attribute is not present a `value` will not be maintained and the Menu Item children of this Menu will not have their `selected` state managed.
attributes.name: selects

slots.description: headline of the menu group

members.name: childRole
members.description:
Hide this getter from web-component-analyzer until
https://github.com/runem/web-component-analyzer/issues/131
has been addressed.

members.name: onFocusableItemAddedOrUpdated
members.description:
When a descendant `<sp-menu-item>` element is added or updated it will dispatch
this event to announce its presence in the DOM. During the capture phase the first
Menu based element that the event encounters will manage the focus state of the
dispatching `<sp-menu-item>` element.

members.name: onSelectableItemAddedOrUpdated
members.description:
When a descendant `<sp-menu-item>` element is added or updated it will dispatch
this event to announce its presence in the DOM. During the bubble phase the first
Menu based element that the event encounters that does not inherit selection will
manage the selection state of the dispatching `<sp-menu-item>` element.

attributes.description: whether the element has a specific selection algorithm that it applies to its item descendants. `single` allows only one descendent to be selected at a time. `multiple` allows many descendants to be selected. `inherit` will be applied dynamically when an ancestor of this element is actively managing the selection of its descendents. When the `selects` attribute is not present a `value` will not be maintained and the Menu Item children of this Menu will not have their `selected` state managed.
attributes.name: selects

events.description: Announces that the `value` of the element has changed

slots.description: content placed at the end of the Menu Item like values, keyboard shortcuts, etc.
slots.name: value

members.name: handleSubmenuChange
members.description:
When there is a `change` event in the submenu for this item
then we "click" this item to cascade the selection up the
menu tree allowing all submenus between the initial selection
and the root of the tree to have their selection changes and
be closed.

events.description: announces the item has been added so a parent menu can take ownerships
events.name: sp-menu-item-added

events.description: announces when removed from the DOM so the parent menu can remove ownership and update selected state

slots.name: negative-help-text

members.name: formatOptions
members.description:
An `<sp-number-field>` element will process its numeric value with
`new Intl.NumberFormat(this.resolvedLanguage, this.formatOptions).format(this.valueAsNumber)`
in order to prepare it for visual delivery in the input. In order to customize this
processing supply your own `Intl.NumberFormatOptions` object here.

See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/NumberFormat/NumberFormat

members.name: hideStepper
members.description: Whether the stepper UI is hidden or not.

members.name: step
members.description:
The distance by which to alter the value of the element when taking a "step".

When `this.formatOptions.style === 'percentage'` the default step will be
set to 0.01 unless otherwise supplied to the element.

members.name: valueAsString
members.description: Retreive the value of the element parsed to a Number.

members.name: setSelectionRange

parameters.name: selectionStart
parameters.description:
The 0-based index of the first selected character. An index greater than the length of the
element's value is treated as pointing to the end of the value.

parameters.name: selectionEnd
parameters.description:
The 0-based index of the character after the last selected character. An index greater than
the length of the element's value is treated as pointing to the end of the value.

parameters.name: selectionDirection
parameters.description:
A string indicating the direction in which the selection is considered to
have been performed.

members.description: Sets the start and end positions of the current selection.

members.name: select
members.description: Selects all the text.

events.name: change
events.description: An alteration to the value of the element has been committed by the user.
The value of the element has changed.
events.name: input

attributes.name: format-options
attributes.description:
An `<sp-number-field>` element will process its numeric value with
`new Intl.NumberFormat(this.resolvedLanguage, this.formatOptions).format(this.valueAsNumber)`
in order to prepare it for visual delivery in the input. In order to customize this
processing supply your own `Intl.NumberFormatOptions` object here.

See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/NumberFormat/NumberFormat

attributes.name: hide-stepper
attributes.description: Whether the stepper UI is hidden or not.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
The distance by which to alter the value of the element when taking a "step".

When `this.formatOptions.style === 'percentage'` the default step will be
set to 0.01 unless otherwise supplied to the element.

members.description: The content of the rows rendered by the virtualized table. The key is the value of the sp-table-row, and the value is the sp-table-row's content (not the row itself).

members.name: itemValue
members.description: The value of an item. By default, it is set to the index of the sp-table-row.

members.name: scroller
members.description: Whether or not the virtualized table has a scroll bar. If this is set to true, make sure to specify a height in the sp-table's inline styles.

members.name: auto
members.description:
Whether to activate a tab on keyboard focus or not.

By default a tab is activated via a "click" interaction. This is specifically intended for when
tab content cannot be displayed instantly, e.g. not all of the DOM content is available, etc.
To learn more about "Deciding When to Make Selection Automatically Follow Focus", visit:
https://w3c.github.io/aria-practices/#kbd_selection_follows_focus

members.name: compact
members.description: The tab items are displayed closer together.

members.name: quiet
members.description: The tab list is displayed without a border.

element's value is treated as pointing to the end of the value.

the length of the element's value is treated as pointing to the end of the value.

have been performed.

The toast content
button element surfacing an action in the Toast
slots.name: action

members.name: timeout
members.description:
When a timeout is provided it represents the number of milliseconds from when
the Toast was placed on the page before it will automatically dismiss itself.
Accessibility concerns require that a Toast is available for at least 6000ms
before being dismissed, so any timeout of less than 6000ms will be raised to
that baseline. It is suggested that messages longer than 120 words should
receive another 1000ms in their timeout for each additional 120 words in the
message. E.G. 240 words = 7000ms, 360 words = 8000ms, etc.

members.name: variant
members.description:
The variant applies specific styling when set to `negative`, `positive`, `info`, `error`, or `warning`.
`variant` attribute is removed when not matching one of the above.

events.name: close
events.description: Announces that the Toast has been closed by the user or by its timeout.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description:
When a timeout is provided it represents the number of milliseconds from when
the Toast was placed on the page before it will automatically dismiss itself.
Accessibility concerns require that a Toast is available for at least 6000ms
before being dismissed, so any timeout of less than 6000ms will be raised to
that baseline. It is suggested that messages longer than 120 words should
receive another 1000ms in their timeout for each additional 120 words in the
message. E.G. 240 words = 7000ms, 360 words = 8000ms, etc.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The variant applies specific styling when set to `negative`, `positive`, `info`, `error`, or `warning`.
`variant` attribute is removed when not matching one of the above.

members.name: getUpdateComplete
members.description:
Bind the open/close transition into the update complete lifecycle so
that the overlay system can wait for it to be "visibly ready" before
attempting to throw focus into the content contained herein. Not
waiting for this can cause small amounts of page scroll to happen
while opening the Tray when focusable content is included: e.g. Menu
elements whose selected Menu Item is not the first Menu Item.

events.name: close
events.description: Announces that the Tray has been closed.

members.name: _doesNotCloseOnFirstClick
members.description:
A "longpress" occurs before the "click" that creates it has occured.
In that way the first click will still be part of the "longpress" and
not part of closing the overlay.

https://spectrum.adobe.com/page/tooltip/#Immediate-or-delayed-appearance
